titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Owens, Judgment
CWG6733

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Pulaski Circuit Court
July Term 1865
The Commonwealth of Ky Plff
against } Judgment
John Owens Deft

This day came the parties by their attornies and announced themselves ready for trial. Then came the Jurors of a Jury to wit John Arthur Duke Covey Milam Young W R Tartar W. J. Carson W. W. Hail B F Simpson Robert Stroud Wm Aker W C Seeher A J Cox John McCury who were elected tried and Sworn will and truly to try the issue Joined herein, and after hearing the evidence and instructions of the court retired to their room and after consultation and deliveration returned into court and on their oaths say we of the Jury find the defendant John Owens guilty of keeping a tipling house
It ordered and adjudged by the court that the plaintiff recover of the defendant John Owens the Sum of $60 -- and her costs herein Expended for which his body may be taken &C

A Copy attest
J. E. Cosson C P C C
And afterwards John Owens paid me the $60= dollars fine with its costs

p.hi: J. E. Cosson C P Circuit Court

body.p:
Commonwealth
vs } Copy of Judgment
John Owens
